question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
During the weekends, Eli delivers milk in the complex plane. On Saturday, he begins at $z$ and delivers milk to houses located at $z^3,z^5,z^7,\ldots,z^{2013}$ in that order; on Sunday, he begins at $1$ and delivers milk to houses located at $z^2,z^4,z^6,\ldots,z^{2012}$ in that order.  Eli always walks directly (in a straight line) between two houses. If the distance he must travel from his starting point to the last house is $\sqrt{2012}$ on both days, find the real part of $z^2$.
inference:
The distance he must travel from his starting point to the last house on Saturday is
$$|z+z^3+z^5+\cdots+z^{2013}-z|=|z(1+z^2+z^4+\cdots+z^{2012})-z|=|z(z^{2012}-1)/(z^2-1)-z|=|z(z^{2012}-1)(z+1)/(z^2-1)z|=|z^{2013}-z|.$$
The distance he must travel from his starting point to the last house on Sunday is
$$|1+z^2+z^4+\cdots+z^{2012}-1|=|z^2+z^4+\cdots+z^{2012}|=|z^2(1+z^2+z^4+\cdots+z^{2010})(z^{2010}-1)/(z^2-1)z^2|=|z^{2012}-z^2|.$$
Since the distances are equal, we have
$$|z^{2013}-z|=|z^{2012}-z^2|.$$
Dividing by $z$ and rearranging, we obtain
$$|z^{2012}-1|=|z^{2012}-z^2|.$$
Since $z^{2012}-1$ and $z^{2012}-z^2$ are never both zero, this means that $z^{2012}-1=z^{2012}-z^2$ or $z^{2012}-1=-(z^{2012}-z^2)$.  Either
$$z^{2012}-1=z^{2012}-z^2\Rightarrow z^2=1$$
or
$$z^{2012}-1=-(z^{2012}-z^2)\Rightarrow 2(z^{2012}-1)=z^2 \Rightarrow z^2=2(z^{2012}-1)=2(z^{2012}-z^{2010}\cdot z^{2010}-1)=2(z^{2010}-1)\left( z^{2010}+z^{2008}+\cdots+z^2+z+1\right).$$
So the real part of $z^2$ is either $1$ or twice the real part of $z^{2010}+z^{2008}+\cdots+z^2+z+1$.  If $z=x+yi$, we have $z^{2010}+z^{2008}+\cdots+z^2+z+1=(x^2-y^2)^{1010}+1010(x^2-y^2)^{1009}xy+1010(x^2-y^2)^{1008}(xy)^2+\cdots+1010(x^2-y^2)xy^{1009}+iy^{1010}+1$, so the real part of $z^{2010}+z^{2008}+\cdots+z^2+z+1$ is $(x^2-y^2)^{1010}+1010(x^2-y^2)^{1009}xy+1010(x^2-y^2)^{1008}(xy)^2+\cdots+1010(x^2-y^2)xy^{1009}+1$.  Therefore, the real part of $z^2$ is either $1$ or $2[(x^2-y^2)^{1010}+1010(x^2-y^2)^{1009}xy+1010(x^2-y^2)^{1008}(xy)^2+\cdots+1010(x^2-y^2)xy^{1009}+1]$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{1}$. I hope it is correct.

question:
The distance he must travel from his starting point to the last house on Saturday is
$$|z+z^3+z^5+\cdots+z^{2013}-z|=|z(1+z^2+z^4+\cdots+z^{2012})-z|=|z(z^{2012}-1)/(z^2-1)-z|=|z(z^{2012}-1)(z+1)/(z^2-1)z|=|z^{2013}-z|.$$
The distance he must travel from his starting point to the last house on Sunday is
$$|1+z^2+z^4+\cdots+z^{2012}-1|=|z^2+z^4+\cdots+z^{2012}|=|z^2(1+z^2+z^4+\cdots+z^{2010})(z^{2010}-1)/(z^2-1)z^2|=|z^{2012}-z^2|.$$
Since the distances are equal, we have
$$|z^{2013}-z|=|z^{2012}-z^2|.$$
Dividing by $z$ and rearranging, we obtain
$$|z^{2012}-1|=|z^{2012}-z^2|.$$
Since $z^{2012}-1$ and $z^{2012}-z^2$ are never both zero, this means that $z^{2012}-1=z^{2012}-z^2$ or $z^{2012}-1=-(z^{2012}-z^2)$.  Either
$$z^{2012}-1=z^{2012}-z^2\Rightarrow z^2=1$$
or
$$z^{2012}-1=-(z^{2012}-z^2)\Rightarrow 2(z^{2012}-1)=z^2 \Rightarrow z^2=2(z^{2012}-1)=2(z^{2012}-z^{2010}\cdot z^{2010}-1)=2(z^{2010}-1)\left( z^{2010}+z^{2008}+\cdots+z^2+z+1\right).$$
So the real part of $z^2$ is either $1$ or twice the real part of $z^{2010}+z^{2008}+\cdots+z^2+z+1$.  If $z=x+yi$, we have $z^{2010}+z^{2008}+\cdots+z^2+z+1=(x^2-y^2)^{1010}+1010(x^2-y^2)^{1009}xy+1010(x^2-y^2)^{1008}(xy)^2+\cdots+1010(x^2-y^2)xy^{1009}+iy^{1010}+1$, so the real part of $z^{2010}+z^{2008}+\cdots+z^2+z+1$ is $(x^2-y^2)^{1010}+1010(x^2-y^2)^{1009}xy+1010(x^2-y^2)^{1008}(xy)^2+\cdots+1010(x^2-y^2)xy^{1009}+1$.  Therefore, the real part of $z^2$ is either $1$ or $2[(x^2-y^2)^{1010}+1010(x^2-y^2)^{1009}xy+1010(x^2-y^2)^{1008}(xy)^2+\cdots+1010(x^2-y^2)xy^{1009}+1]$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{1}$. I hope it is correct.
